episodes.original_body:
Case: Cory-Stephenson-MVA-9-03-2025
Client: Cory Stephenson

New Insurance Note: 9/5 State Farm denied liability, stated their insured had control of the intersection and made the turn on a yellow light, our client disregarded traffic light
Insurance Type: Bodily Injury (BI)
Insurance Company: State Farm Insurance Company
Written by: Justin Chumbley
episodes.natural_language:
Case Cory-Stephenson-MVA-9-03-2025 involves client Cory Stephenson in a motor vehicle accident dated September 3, 2025. 

A new insurance note dated September 5, 2025 from State Farm Insurance Company, the Bodily Injury (BI) insurer, states that liability is denied. State Farm contends that their insured had control of the intersection and made the turn on a yellow light, and that Cory Stephenson disregarded the traffic light. The note was written by Justin Chumbley.
episodes.author: Aaron

about.relevance: BI claim discussed; liability denial noted

episodes.original_body:
Case: Cory-Stephenson-MVA-9-03-2025

Person Making Contact: Justin
Date & Time: September 04 2025
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on September 4, 2025, with Justin regarding a motor vehicle accident involving Cory Stephenson. The client, Cory Stephenson, was born on August 16, 1998 (SSN 405-53-1754) and can be reached at 502-303-6254. He resides at 5017 Yaupon Lane, Louisville, KY 40213. The date of the accident was September 3, 2025, at Newburg Road, where Cory was the driver and another vehicle ran a red light, resulting in a T-bone collision. The crash occurred in West Beuchal, and the front end of Cory’s vehicle sustained damage.

EMS transported Cory to UofL Downtown. Injuries reported include injuries to the head, neck, back, left leg, right ankle, and left arm. His health insurance is Humana Medicaid. Auto insurance information indicates an Enterprise rental was in the name of Donisha Brock, who is the mother of the client’s son. The contact was made by Justin, on September 4, 2025.
episodes.author: Aaron
